name: KOI-3680
scenarioDescription:
The KOI-3680 Exoplanetary System


Overview

KOI-3680 is a star with 1.01 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.96 times its radius. It is located 3087.36 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.2 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

KOI-3680 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the KOI-3680 system


KOI-3680 b

KOI-3680 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.53 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of KOI-3680 b is 613.74 times the mass of Earth. The radius of KOI-3680 b is 11.097 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, KOI-3680 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system KOI-3680, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
